page.title: 17H.H. COLLINS OF BROADWAY.
page.content: {H. H. Collins of Broadway}was founded in 1900. It is a limited company, the directors belonging to the Collins and Knight families. There are 60 full time staff who manufacture fresh pork products for a prestige market, e.g. {Harrods of London,}as well as for local outlets. A large consignment of York Hams was recently exported to the Sudan. The pork is obtained from animals slaughtered on the premises, and the pastry used in their pies is hand raised following a thousand years'old tradition.The smallest pie produced weighs a quarter of a pound.The largest is a yard long weighing 15lb. The more exotic products are Turkey, Ham and Cranberry Pie, Chicken, Chestnut and Red Wine Pie, and the latest venture 'Stow Pie' (diced beef & venison in a rich Burgundy sauce).
